alert.note: Alert for La Crosse; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 4:54AM CDT until April 27 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River Near Galesville affecting La Crosse and Trempealeau Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. .The combination of snow melt and rainfall has resulted in Moderate flooding for Galesville. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River Near Galesville. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 AM CDT Sunday was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river crested at 14.48 feet Saturday evening. It will continue to fall below flood stage Wednesday. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 03/13/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued by Noon today.
